Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libpciaccess
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libpciaccess bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated libpciaccess packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3.z. The libpciaccess library provides portable PCI access routines across multiple operating systems.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, the X.org server failed to start on machines with 32-bit PCI domains. A PCI domain does not need to be limited to the 16-bits. The Linux kernel currently supports 32-bit domains, which cause the startx utility to fail with segmentation fault. However, updating libpciaccess to support 32-bit domains breaks the library's application binary interface (ABI), and domains that require 32-bits are not necessary for startx. Therefore, this patch ignores these domains, and the problem no longer occurs. (BZ#1401462)
All users of libpciaccess are advised to upgrade to these updated packages that fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
